KAxgrx17Wv-R6NPQ0HTxnA.text: Popped in for a spot of herbal tea after a long day of travel. It is so convenient to have such a great little space in our hotel. I Travel a lot, and don't normally see such an extensive menu in a hotel.  Having said that, I was just in it for the peppermint tea tonight. Our server was quick and polite. He brought everything out on a tray with our own little teapot. Swing by to relax after enjoying Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

VU042ANMhUW_F_m1A-2Dkw.text: Let me start by saying I'm a Marriott loyalist. This has to be one of the worst dinning experiences I've ever had at a Marriott propriety. I flew in from LA extremely tired so decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. The service was horribly slow and the restaurant wasn't that busy. I ordered the chowder to start and a ribeye as the main. The chowder was bland, no seafood at all, salt and pepper helped. As for the steak... I ordered the $24 ribeye medium. Their first attempt came out and it honestly looked like someone's left overs. I was afraid if I ate it I would get sick. I sent it back and to my surprise a decent steak appeared in about a 1/3 the time of the first order.  This place is good for a drink but do not eat here. Hotel is that great either. Stay next door at the Glasshouse. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The one they replaced it with... unreal
Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. $24 ribeye?!?!?!  Really!!!!! You&#39;ve got to be kidding me!

KNxPJFjD1zzE3cVx6bepJA.text: We checked into the Marriott hotel yesterday and were too tired to go anywhere else so stayed for dinner. It was actually quite good. Good selection for cocktails and wine. I had Coq au Vin and my husband had a Venison dish, both were well cooked with tasty sauces. Nice place.

qvm7P9-9SHOumer7KqVmqw.text: Inside the new Courtyard in Edinburgh on Baxter's Pl near Waverly Station, this is a bar and restaurant that is open to the public but mainly caters to guests. We dropped in for a nightcap during our stay at the Courtyard. Since the whole building is brand new, there was still some spray plain and glue smells around the bar. The tap beer selection was not half-bad with about 4 Scottish beers to choose from. We sampled a few, but they were not tasting great.  Tap beers were poured into clean glassware with ample, 1liter mug pours. They also had a surprising amount of bottled beer as well. The Scotch selection was impressive for this venue - served in proper, upscale glassware. Our bartender was friendly throughout the evening. There's a restaurant attached but we didn't eat there.   This was a pretty clutch find as they were open for drinks until midnight on a Sunday.

6sVFH6KuMJ9mOjEp-11a6Q.text: You would be better off at McDonald's for a burger. The burger was burnt to a crisp and chewy. They said that's how it comes, but it was barely edible. The service and beer were fine, but I can't recall having a worse hamburger.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lantern Room - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ate part because I was starving, but that&#39;s the patty

yqOrylBy2qJHKAi3ge9Fug.text: After a long day of sightseeing, we stopped at the Lantern Room for dinner. Both I and my daughter ordered fish and chips, and had one of the best fish and chip dinners I ever tasted. For dessert we ordered the sticky toffee pudding, which was out of this world! The staff was very friendly and welcoming.
